## Cost of Equity Capital

```{r}
#| eval: true
#| results: asis
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
mrp <- rnorm(1, mean = 8, sd = 0.01)
rf <- rnorm(1, mean = 5, sd = 0.01)
beta <- rnorm(1, mean = 1, sd = 0.2)
em <- mrp + rf
mrp2 <- rnorm(1, mean = 8, sd = 0.01)
rf2 <- rnorm(1, mean = 5, sd = 0.01)
beta2 <- rnorm(1, mean = 1, sd = 0.2)
em2 <- mrp + rf
```

::: {.question-block}

<form onsubmit="event.preventDefault(); checkNumericAnswer('module4_num_q1a')" style="display: flex; flex-direction: row; gap: 6px;">
  <label for="module4_num_q1a"><strong>Suppose a security's beta is `r round(beta,2)`. If the risk-free rate is `r round(rf,2)`% and the market risk premium is `r round(mrp,2)`%, what is the security's cost of equity capital?</strong></label>
  <input type="number" id="module4_num_q1a" name="module4_num_q1a" placeholder="Enter value" style="width: 150px;"
         data-correct-answer=`r round(rf + (beta * mrp),2)` data-tolerance="0.01" />
</form>

<div id="feedback-module4_num_q1a" class="feedback" data-status="" style="display:none;">

</div>
